oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Direct biosynthesis of ascorbic acid from glucose by Xanthomonas campestris through induced free-radicals
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAO, YM
SURESHKUMAR, GK

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ascorbic acid (20.4 g l(-1) in 50 h) was synthesized directly from glucose by Xanthomonas campestris as an adaptive response to induced free-radicals through HOCl treatment. Identity of ascorbic acid was confirmed through IR and NMR spectroscopy.
